intro: Hermas rudissima, commonly known as the rough leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hermas rudissima is often found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides, thriving in a variety of soil types.
